Package com.shelfsync.services

Class CategoryService

java.lang.Object
com.shelfsync.services.CategoryService
@Service public class CategoryService extends Object
Service for managing item category operations.

Handles CRUD operations for categories, which are used to classify inventory items. Categories must have unique names and can be associated with multiple items.

Key business rules:

  • Category names must be unique
  • Categories cannot be deleted if they are associated with existing items

  • Method Details

    • create

      public CategoryDto create(CategoryDto dto)
      Creates a new category with the specified name.

      Validates that the category name is unique before creating the category.

      Parameters:
      dto - The category data transfer object containing the category name
      Returns:
      The created category
      Throws:
      ResourceConflictException - if the category name is already in use

    • findAllCategories

      public List<CategoryDto> findAllCategories()
      Retrieves all categories in the system.
      Returns:
      A list of all categories

    • findById

      public CategoryDto findById(Integer id)
      Retrieves a specific category by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The category ID
      Returns:
      The category
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the category does not exist

    • update

      public CategoryDto update(Integer id, CategoryDto dto)
      Updates an existing category's name.
      Parameters:
      id - The category ID
      dto - The category data transfer object with updated name
      Returns:
      The updated category
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the category does not exist

    • deleteById

      public void deleteById(Integer id)
      Deletes a category by its ID.

      Validates that the category is not in use before deletion. A category cannot be deleted if it is associated with any existing items.

      Parameters:
      id - The category ID to delete
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the category does not exist
      ResourceConflictException - if the category is associated with existing items
